website_summaries.verdict: A wonderful lumbar support pillow intended for home or office use.
pros: Consists of high-quality foam to ensure the cushion is constructed to last
Includes a 100 percent non-wrinkle polyester cover that can be removed and washed as needed
Simple to attach the cushion to office chairs, car seats and other seats
cons: Straps may move around at times
May be too narrow for some users

customer_reviews.title: A Cheap Piece Of Junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of junk. As soon as I received it, I went to strap it around my chair, and the strapped ripped right off. An inspection showed how thin the thread was holding it to the thin liner. I made up my mind to use it anyway, and then the seam ripped on the other side (See photo). Save your money. Don’t buy this product. Roll up a towel, tape it with duct tape, and voila—a real, sturdy, and even washable lumbar roll.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Buczinsky

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: No matter what you do this thing does not stay put. It slips up, it slips down, it flings off to the side when you try to get into the car, and if you even try to move slightly while you're driving it pops up. Along with this, it's so squishy that it doesn't actually provide real lumbar support. Definitely not worth the money. I will go back to my physical therapists original idea and roll up a towel as it's just as effective if not more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is it Me?
customer_reviews.text: I am a slim woman, about 5' 4". Recently diagnosed with lumbar osteoporosis. I do not have pain but wanted something for lower back support. I was very excited to receive this roll. When I tried it, instead of filling the natural gap in my lumbar area, which is what it should do, it felt like I was sitting against a large brick. Way, way too fat, and I couldn't get it to soften at all. Then when I saw what was inside the case, I couldn't believe the price....a piece of foam rubber? OMG. What a piece of junk. Glad it works for others tho.
customer_reviews.author: Glinda

customer_reviews.title: OK, but underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I find the roll compresses to approximately 1 inch thick when leaned on. (I bought the standard density). Relatively comfortable, even if not as structurally sound as I'd expect. I'm disappointed in the strap, too. It's a stretchy material, which means that no matter how snugly you attach it to your chair, the roll droops. Looking at the strain this puts on the ends of the strap where it's attached to the roll, I can't imagine these connections holding up for any length of time. Bottom line, I think this is an okay product right out of the box, but doesn't appear that it would have a very long lifespan for me.
customer_reviews.author: simplysteph

customer_reviews.title: Great lumbar support
customer_reviews.text: I got this roll originally in the 1980s from a physical therapist. I used it on and off for years until several years ago when I began using it three days a week to make the dialysis chair less uncomfortable. It finally got too soft so I replaced it a few weeks ago. It is a great lumbar support. It is lightweight but firm enough to support your lower back. I don't use the strap (except to carry it) but I think it would be useful in some situations.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.G

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Back Straight
customer_reviews.text: I've got really bad posture, always have, always will. My lower back bears the brunt of this and I'll have garden variety lower back pain from time to time (or consistently at times). A physical therapist recommend this lumbar roll and it makes me sit up straight. I've tried a number of these lumbar supports and most don't really modify my behavior, I end up slouching on the lumbar roll. Not possible with this one. Now, if you're looking for a comfy lumbar support for sitting all day at a desk or in a car this might not be the one for you. But that's exactly why it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: nacnud

customer_reviews.title: Relieves back pain
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these in physical therapy. It helped right off with my lower back stiffness and pain. I have it in my recliner now and it is very comfortable. I just bought another for my car. I'm going to bring it with me on vacation for the plane too. I highly recommend to anyone that has back pain. It's working for me, I hope it works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Donna F. McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Use Every Day!!  Helps So Much!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this every day for months! I have 2 other Mckenzie Original D-Section lumbar rolls - one I've had for years - and still going strong. I use one in the car and carry one with me to use when I am out at events, restaurants, etc. They have helped me so much that I rarely go anywhere without one. I usually use the full lumbar roll for work and the D-Section rolls for the car, when I go out, or when sitting at home. The full just fits my office chair better - but the D-section rolls seem firmer. Great products and long lasting! So thankful for these rolls!
customer_reviews.author: M Hawk

customer_reviews.title: The industry standard for lumbar support rolls, the McKenzie ...
customer_reviews.text: The industry standard for lumbar support rolls, the McKenzie is an essential piece of my lower back rehabilitation. My physical therapist insists on having one of these in the car, at work, and wherever else I sit. This original roll is not overly firm, but definitely provides the right amount of support to keep the hollow of your back from resting flat on the chair. This ergonomic posture allows the vertebrae to properly align, which will allow them to heal. Slouching places added stress on to our spine by taking it out of its intended shape, so the roll works to maintain that correct posture and reduce the load on the spine.
customer_reviews.author: walterman

customer_reviews.title: Falling in love!
customer_reviews.text: It's only day 1, but I am already noticing a REAL difference after using this at work. I have been having low back problems and my doctor recommended getting a McKenzie Lumbar Roll to use at work to help with my posture and to help relieve some of the back pain. The result was INSTANTANEOUS for me! I was not expecting it, honestly. I am going to give it a few more days, but I am already considering purchasing another one for my car/home so I don't have to drag one around all the time. Highly recommend if you are experiencing low to mid back pain when sitting!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T.

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Repositioning It
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think about it when I bought it, but this is a cylinder and it wants to roll up and down the back of the chair/seat when you sit down. When you get up. When you move. Consequently, you are frequently moving it back into place. The elastic strap doesn't help and becomes a twisted mess shortly after you start using this support. Several people have mentioned to me that they don't use the elastic strap at all and place it each time they sit down. My suggestion would be to consider a support that isn't prone to rolling up and down the back of the seat or chair.
customer_reviews.author: A Person with Reasonable Standards

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be more firm
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, but I honestly thought it would be more firm to offer more back support. The memory foam is just way too soft and this is not a returnable item. If you suffer from serious back pain like sciatica, etc., I don't recommend that you purchase this item for your car or office chair. I drove for 6 1/2 hours with it and although it helped my posture, it did nothing to alleviate the pain in my lower back/lumbar area. It's too soft for that. May be ok if you're looking just to use it for ergonomic purposes to improve your posture when you sit, but that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Fidelis

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My sciatica was bothering me, and I had gone to the chiropractor the last time it acted up and I didn’t get any relief. I was hesitant to try again, My daughter suggested this product. To be honest, I wasn’t sure it would work, however, I needed to try something. I ordered it and i received it in two days. It is amazing, Within a couple of days I could see an 85% difference. After a week, I didn’t need to use it. But the good news is that if do need it, I have it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Firm
customer_reviews.text: I’m in physical therapy for back pain after a fall. To avoid constant heat on my back, I wanted some relief while driving or sitting in my living room or office. My therapist recommended lumbar support so I ordered this one. It is easy to use/transport. It is solid and firm. At times, it feels almost too firm. I may be better suited for support in the shape of a 1/2 circle rather than a full circle.
customer_reviews.author: Ophelia

customer_reviews.title: FLIGHT MUST HAVE!!
customer_reviews.text: I fly a lot for both work and pleasure. Purchasing this support roll has truly changed the way I fly. I clip it onto my backpack with my neck pillow to carry it in. Once on board I slide it behind me and when I land I have zero pain! Until airlines can craft a seat with proper lumbar support, I highly recommend investing in one of these for all your travel! Whether is be the car, a plane or a train, buy one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I think it worked for a while???
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lumbar roll support while I was pregnant. I was experiencing extreme PGP and lower back pain through early pregnancy. I was attending physical therapy on a regular basis, and they recommended that I purchase this for my office chair. I used it during my pregnancy and I've gotten so used to it that I continue to use it after. I notice that is hasn't kept it circular shape. It is more oval now. And by the end of the day, I can't even tell that it is there because I have flattened it by leaning against it all day. I really don't know what help it is doing any more and it is only 7 months old.
customer_reviews.author: HTHONLINE

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use, nice little support pillow.
customer_reviews.text: I have been moving this item around with me. I have used it at work, with my computer chair at home and also in the car. It's a great little pillow that has an excellent shape, size and firmness to support my back. While the adjusting belt doesn't really keep the item in place well (weight of the pillow pulls it down)it's easy enough to readjust. I'm happy with me purchase. It's not perfect but it does what I need it for. No extra bells or whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Srae

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size, small enough to put in my carry on and it has a strap to attach as well. I can easily place it wherever my back is hurting and it instantly relieves most of the pain. Great for a long plane ride!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Gurion

customer_reviews.title: Better Posture - Better Back Support
customer_reviews.text: I have tried both the Original and the Firm OPTP lumbar roll. I prefer the Original. I believe it helps stack my spinal column correctly when I sit. It encourages you to sit more erect. Should be great for long drives. I like it on my office chair. I "exercise" against it; rolling my shoulders back as far as I can. Feels good. Helps with flexibility I think.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend the book "Treat Your Own Back" (link
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist got me into the McKenzie method, and I am a big fan. I do the stretches every day. I highly recommend the book "Treat Your Own Back" (link:  In making some small postural changes, especially sitting at work or in a car for lengthy trips, I use the SuperRoll (link: I bought this to see if it would work as well or better. It does not. It flattened and did not provide good support during use at work on in the car, and just was not as effective or durable as the SuperRoll. The only reason I did not return it was that it was past the deadline. Buy the SuperRoll instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps posture healthy as I use a computer
customer_reviews.text: In my case, lifelong bad posture leads to lower back pain and leg discomfort and werakness. However, with this MacKenzie Original roll I have my healthiest posture during those longish periods when I am using my computer or reading. I am slowly training myself to pay attention to "MacKernzie" posture when I am not sitting, when walking, preparing things in the kitchen, and exercising. I am glad my physical therapist recommended MacKenzie. I also have similar MacKenzie for my car.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful#3

customer_reviews.title: Get the firm version
customer_reviews.text: The one I purchased smashed flat as soon as I leaned back against it. Completely ineffectual. It was only once I came to give a review that I saw there is a firm option, which I’m ordering now. I’ll review that one once it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: lacye lee

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but The Size is Right for this Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but a quality product in the right dimensions for a car or any ordinary chair where you want back support. I purchased a similar product a while ago that is thicker and significantly longer. It turned out to be unusable, because it was too long to fit any of several chairs where I wanted to use it, and too bulky as well. When you buy one of these lumbar supports, think of your back, of course, but think of where you will use it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Squishes pretty well but still supportive
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Squishes pretty well but still supportive. Elastic band occasionally slips - but like that I can WEAR it if need be (from floor to floor within the house) - or just tether to chair. Decent value for price. Might go for removable cover next time as already showing a splotch though not sure how it got there - sticky fingers??
customer_reviews.author: S Coppedge

customer_reviews.title: Quality and size do not match up with the price tag
customer_reviews.text: Def Not worth the price !!! Does not tighten/ adjust correctly. Super small and I am only 5’4 and 130 pounds... and it provides no real support may as well have rolled a towel or pillow and put it behind my back instead. I will most likely be returning this item and searching for another one for a cheaper price and better quality
customer_reviews.author: Sara Almoh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.  Does the job.  Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I fell many years ago and crushed 4 lumbar vertebrae. I've used this back roll off and on for many years. I've occasionally misplaced them. Easy to forget them in a cab, for example. This new one was the same as the original 30 years or so ago. Excellent!! Very comfortable. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Made well
customer_reviews.text: It's made well and squishes when squeezed, but pops right back. It's hard to know what's hard and what's soft for others when reading the reviews. It's comfortable for me, not too hard not too soft, and is doing what I needed. I also like using it for a neck roll.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan

customer_reviews.title: strap ripped and had zipper fall off in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: bought this towards the end of june for my computer chair at home. not even 3 months later and stitching is ripping off, causing the zipper to fall off. the elastic band is pretty shoddy, you will find yourself adjusting it constantly, at least until the stitching connecting it to the cushion rips within a few months. cushion is already warped and lost most of its initial firmness
customer_reviews.author: lar

customer_reviews.title: It doesnt stay still on my office chair
customer_reviews.text: The strap is not strong enough to keep the pillow still on my chair while im moving around working. Makes no sense. The pillow is soft but it doesn’t matter because it doesnt stay in one spot. I pulled the strap very tightly, but it didnt help, and now I cant return it😒
customer_reviews.author: Eula Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second lumbar pillow I’ve purchased for my long commute. This was a recommendation from my chiropractor and I love it! So much better than the stiffer memory foam one I had been using. It almost feels too soft but supports perfectly and is easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Wood

customer_reviews.title: Get this now, if you need a good back pillow for your chair!
customer_reviews.text: This has really been a life saver for me lately. I have lower back issues and needed a pillow for the chair when I am sitting up using my laptop in front of me. It sits in just the right place in your back to support it. I was worried it would be to firm for my liking but is just the right pressure you need. They do say it feels weird when you first try it and it does but after that it feels comfortable. Mine was the standard just in case you did not search reviews for the standard only.
customer_reviews.author: GingerAle

customer_reviews.title: Used!
customer_reviews.text: The product I received was clearly worn, and the strap was torn from where it should be sewn. There was no indication of this in the description that this would be a used item. It would probably be a fine product, but If I'm paying top price, I want a new item.
customer_reviews.author: Bike Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Definitely helps with lumbar support!
customer_reviews.text: Really relieves sciatica and L4-L5 herniated disc pain (for me personally). Great support in car, on couch, and sitting in bed to read or watch tv. I really am very happy with purchasing this product. My physical therapist said it was a smart purchase👍
customer_reviews.author: Rhona

customer_reviews.title: Use this daily
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended to use by my PT. I've bought a few of these for my sofa, desk chair and dining chair. Perfect support for sitting correctly and treating low back sciatica pain when you have to sit. I use a thinner lumbar roll for the car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Lumber Roll!
customer_reviews.text: This is a much needed lumbar pillow for your driving and sitting needs! Very easy to travel (when you travel again). It gives wonderful lumbar support. I have had this lumbar pillow for years! Good quality and will last.
customer_reviews.author: Daphsam Photography & Art

customer_reviews.title: Back Savior
customer_reviews.text: I actually really love this thing. I only got it cause my back is so messed up from standing all day long and my chiropractor told me I had to get it. When it came in I though it was gonna be stupid and pointless. Literally the best thing of my life. I’m worried it’s gonna wear down fast. (I do drive a lot so that doesn’t help) and it doesn’t seem as stiff maybe as Id thing it to be. I have to kinda move it around depending on how long I’ve been driven for but sometimes the idea of driving home is life changing. I HIGHLY recommend this guy. I wanna buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Too large. Must be for Large people over 200lbs
customer_reviews.text: This is too large for my back. I'm 130lbs, a woman. Have back pain from my SUV. This product is much too large. I could see it being used as a pillow to sleep on but not for back Support. It's too firm and doesn't fit the lower back.
customer_reviews.author: JC76

customer_reviews.title: Good back support
customer_reviews.text: This is terrific for the car on long trips. I like it because you can easily maneuver it up and down your back for comfort. It is soft but large so you feel the support. I don't use the strap because I like to remove it when I need a break. It still stays in place when you lean back on it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindie B

customer_reviews.title: It will do the job
customer_reviews.text: The roll is a bit round, firm and “out there”, but given that some reviewers have stated that it compresses over time, I expect it to be better after I’ve used it a while. It could also use another strap (a vertical one perhaps) because I’ve had to stabilize it top to bottom with a tie in order to keep it from dropping down too low. All in all, though, I expect this roll will be much better than the inflatables, my last two of which have leaked. Just to note, this roll isn’t as wide as my inflatables were (across the back of the chair) but it feels wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awkward size
customer_reviews.text: The roll was to round for my small frame and oddly not wide enough to support full back. I'm little and had to cut roll in half for driving. It doesn't stay where I put it, often creeps up. Not a good choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: DKay

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered from shoulder and neck pain for almost 10 years now. It doesn't help that I sit at a desk all day. This little cushion works wonders!! It was a little awkward the first day I used it but I quickly became used to it. Now I sit up straight with little to no effort and it has drastically improved my shoulder and neck condition. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cardozo

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: My husband's PT person recommended this and we were excited to get it. It didn't help at all and even lost its support all together within a couple of days. Definitely don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hill

customer_reviews.title: Super hard with no give
customer_reviews.text: Super hard. Could not use it as a lumbar support because it was like a rock behind my back with no give at all. I ended up using it as a support between my knees when I sleep on my side. It works excellent for this purpose, since it has no give.
customer_reviews.author: chi2chi

customer_reviews.title: great for neck, not lumbar support
customer_reviews.text: For the price...no. for $10 ea. Maybe. Probably returning. Very soft and very small. Could be five inches longer and a little firmer. Great for a neck pillow, not lumbar support
customer_reviews.author: deborah

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for sciatica sufferer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this together with ComfieLife cushion. It works magic for my sciatica pain. If your job requires to sit a lot and you have sciatica problem, you need to get this.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer from San Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and right size
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been doing McKenzie exercises for over 10 yrs due to herniated discs, and always rely on these rolls to help posture in car, work chair even being a Herman Miller Aeron. I believe everyone should use them.
customer_reviews.author: @Bella

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my office chair. It was desperately needed to help with lower back pain from lumbar disc bulge. Sitting is a challenge and this gives you the right support and keeps you in the proper position for sitting.
customer_reviews.author: AHG

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for roughly 6 months, and this has fallen apart. the strap broke off, then the zipper stopped working, not sure if this was a dud, or an example of the lack of quality, but if i wouldn't be surprised if by the 1 year mark, this just disintegrated and turned to dust...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z

customer_reviews.title: I find it a wonderful purchase and it makes my sitting position very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: after reading 7 steps to a pain free life Relieve back, neck and shoulder pain in which Robin McKenzie stress my posture will help if I improve it,I purchased the Lumbar Roll to use in my chair because I have not decided on a lounge chair to use. I find it a wonderful purchase and it makes my sitting position very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: great back relief
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to this lumbar roll by my physical therapist about 6 years ago when I suffered from a herniated disk in my lower lumbar. It's incredible what a difference it makes in my ability to sit at my desk or drive. If you have lower back problems I suggest you try this. It improves my sitting posture and takes off pressure. The seller provided prompt delivery and followed up to ensure I was satisfied with my order. Excellent experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You notice the change
customer_reviews.text: Really good 👍. Not what I was expecting as per firmness but definitely works. Reduces back pain a lot.ni can spend 5+ hrs sitting and my back feels okay. My physical therapist recommended this brand in particular and she has more than two decades giving therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Andy N.

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: This works for me. Just the right size. Many lumbar pads are just too large. I use this in my classic English sports car. I can shift it to just the right position.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t really help as I expected
customer_reviews.text: At first when I bought this product, it would look helpful but it doesn’t. My lower backs been killing me and maybe if I bought this to help support my lower back I would feel much better. It depends on the person but it’s kind of a okay product. Wouldn’t highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend who sits in construction equipment all day and he’s 6’4”. As most people he has bad posture but being in tight and enclosed space does not help. He has used it for about a week now and he loves it. He reports that he has not had as much pain, if at all in his back and hips. Definitely worth a shot to try it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the worst made products I have ever ordered through amazon.com. I unpacked it when I received it and try to use the zipper but the plastic wrapped around the foam roll kept jamming the zipper. I took it out, removed the plastic and try to re-insert the foam roll. The casing literally unravelled. I wouldn't pay $5 for this product at a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my physical therapist but don’t like that it won’t stay in place. It keeps collapsing and I need to push it back into shape. Not great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Susan I

customer_reviews.title: It gave me new pain and I actually felt much worse. I tried a different lumbar support that doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a try for a couple weeks. It gave me new pain and I actually felt much worse. I tried a different lumbar support that doesn't create a pressure point across one spot in my back, and it did help. So it seems a lumbar support can definitely make a difference, but, for me, certainly not this one. Additionally, it's not very long. I'm not a large person, but if I were this probably wouldn't have reached all the way across my back. Don't waste your money. Get something that supports your posture without feeling like a rock in the middle of your back.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Dane

customer_reviews.title: Positioning
customer_reviews.text: The lumbar support does not fit where it needs to go. I tried raising it with the strap but it still shifts and is not worth the fight.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna Y. Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Soft and easy to place
customer_reviews.text: It is soft and easy to place on an office chair, but it is slightly too big for me. I think it would be better half the size. No other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: I like my 99 Cent Only Store mesh lumbar support much better!
customer_reviews.text: The standard density roll felt firm to me. It was much too firm to be comfortable at different heights I tried it at between my lower & mid back. And its strap was much too weak to hold it in place on my car bucket seat. And I tried it for about a week to get used to it, like the manufacturer recommended. But it never felt comfortable to me.
customer_reviews.author: A1 Computer Consulting

customer_reviews.title: My chair low back pillow
customer_reviews.text: At first it was making me slide off chair. Once I positioned just about top of pants line it is comfortable and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda S Doege

customer_reviews.title: Office Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: This has made a difference as I'm petite statue so the ergo office chairs still not custom to my frame and I need lumbar support. This is good for anyone to have in the office especially sitting all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sit up straight and save your life.
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to as it's nice and stiff. I have lousy posture so it will take some getting used to, but I hope it helps me w my computer neck. Sitting all day is horrible. I wish I'd take care of my posture years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Poor adjustable strap design
customer_reviews.text: The roll itself is supportive and works well enough. The problem is with the adjustable strap - it’s made of elastic that stretches out over just a few days’ time. This flawed design causes the roll to droop and sag on the back of your chair shortly after retightening the strap. I’ve decided to get a lumbar roll from a different manufacturer that uses nylon for its strap!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back and made my uncomfortable office chair comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical as I purchased this product but from the first time I tried it out I knew instantly I wouldn't regret this purchase. After sitting all day at work I was incredibly achy and lopsided (due to my own posture issues), this forced me to sit up properly and helped my alignment. I no longer am in pain after a long day of work. So glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Prancing unicorn 8

customer_reviews.title: Not quite for me
customer_reviews.text: I used this a few days in my office. Perhaps it's just me, but my bulged disc was more agitated after using it. With that said, I love the McKenzie method and his book.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: It is supposed to be a soft back pillow and it is very hard. It forces the back to curve too much so it is not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squishes flat, doesn’t hold shape fir support, returned it
customer_reviews.text: It seems well made but it squished almost to nothing so at first you have support but then after a few minutes it just squished flat. Returned it
customer_reviews.author: J & K Mac

customer_reviews.title: This is very firm and shape is unyielding.
customer_reviews.text: I found it too firm because, due to its size, I could not rest the upper back against a chair. It would definitely not work well in my car. I am searching for the low compliance version that my PT showed me- guess I bought the wrong product. It is returnable though so that was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: C12345

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: It just didn't work for me. I had a L5S1 fusion in October 2019. The lumbar roll didn't work for me. Maybe I used it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Hall

customer_reviews.title: I now own three of these!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my third McKenzie Lumbar Roll yesterday. I now have one for work, one for home, and one for the car. I picked them up after reading that they were inexpensive and the best you could get without paying Relax the Back prices (no thanks). I have two bulging disks and these rolls really help me maintain proper posture. The best thing about this model is that they retain their shape and don't collapse during daily use. That's about all you can ask for. The band sticks pretty well to the chairs I use. Should I lose one of these I'll certainly be buying a fourth lol.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Chapin

customer_reviews.title: You forget it's there but it sure supports your lower back
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my physical therapist who told me his family uses these. The support is very nice and the 'pillow' is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: cathy k

customer_reviews.title: ... for someone who has lower back scoliosis and a bad posture. My physical therapist recommend I start using ...
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for someone who has lower back scoliosis and a bad posture. My physical therapist recommend I start using a lumbar and I chose to buy this one. It gets the job done, the only thing that would personally make it better for me if it was a little bit harder. It sometimes gets squished by my back and doesn't give me the hefty support I am looking for on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Gives just enough compression to (a) do the job while (b) remaining comfortable. Not an easy balance, but this design does it for me. Its shape and size make it easy to put it just where you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank in Miami

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lower back relief when in car
customer_reviews.text: My husband was told about these for his lower back issues. Best gift we ever received. we bought extra for my car and one for his office.
customer_reviews.author: Celina Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Well Okay Then
customer_reviews.text: Hmmm. I like the book "Treat Your Own Back" and the exercises have done me good, but this thing is a bit too much. I don't know if that means my back is not in too bad a shape, or not in too good a shape. Mostly pleasant and mostly harmless I guess. It *is* constructed from high quality materials, and I don't think the price was unreasonable.
customer_reviews.author: roketdr

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product, was difficult to affix to my office chair where it would stay in place before and after sitting down and back up
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wall

customer_reviews.title: You would love it!
customer_reviews.text: Use this all the time! At home, put under back and under neck to chill after work; also very help at the airplane , more than just head cover. Also use behind low back at the car!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Offers no support
customer_reviews.text: Product is way too soft and offers zero support. Im 170lbs and when I lean back on it, it squishes completely flat and offers no support for my back. A rolled up beach towel has been 1000% more effective. I gave it 2 stars because the fabric is quality.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Nice and firm back support
customer_reviews.text: This back support roll is working out great for me. I bought two, one for my car seat and one for my desk chair at work. The support is very firm and keeps my back straight. This was a good purchase and I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort while driving.
customer_reviews.text: Seller perfect. Strap fits over my seat for easy access to my back It's what I needed. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: The lumbar support can be attached around your waist which makes it very convenient and versatile. I use the support when I go to a ball game and also to the movie theaters.
customer_reviews.author: RMM

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as old one
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used McKenzie rolls for years. My old one was several years old and due for replacement and ordered this one. It is not the same. It squished down to nothing giving no support. The old one does better. I’m wondering if this is an imitation or knock off. If not then the quality has gone way down. Should have ordered from more reliable source.
customer_reviews.author: crystal tetlow

customer_reviews.title: What a smart idea!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute must for people that need that little extra cushion for lumbar support. Sit all the way back in a chair and slip this little puppy right into that lumbar curve and pain just disappears. What a smart idea!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps eliminate back pain!
customer_reviews.text: This lumbar roll provides relief when sitting in one position for any length of time. It is very portable and easy to use. I left my first one on an airplane and immediately ordered another one, that’s how invaluable this small roll has become, I highly recommend it to anyone with lower back pain!
customer_reviews.author: Zelia Paul

customer_reviews.title: Likely helps if surgery is not an option.
customer_reviews.text: May be a great product,too uncomfortable for me to use because it turned out I needed back surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Works good for support
customer_reviews.text: this does work very good for support. The problem is that the fabric they used is very scratchy! They should have used a softer, less rough fabric for the pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: OPTP Mckensie Roll is the one if you have a bad back
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. I've been using these OPTP Mckensie rolls for over 20 years since a serious back injury. I have them in all vehicles, work chairs... I even take one in my laptop bag for long meetings on travel. This roll is far superior to a couple others that looked and cost the same at the local drug store...but which were not durable and whose effectiveness was only a couple of days (they compressed and stayed compressed); I got fooled... Stick with OPTP; they sell the original roll and it works as advertised. The extra firm is especially useful for long trips in the car.
customer_reviews.author: John David

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing this for my bf. Helps his back when driving. Good quality and does provide support.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: feeling good
customer_reviews.text: The roll is made of good material, sturdy, convenient to use and really supports my lower back.
customer_reviews.author: EJB

customer_reviews.title: Most people should use thi
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect to help support your back. Hut u uave to read the directions and sit properly using it to help back pain. This is is perfect for me, but a larger taller person may need a mckenzie roll that is bigger, like their firm roll
customer_reviews.author: camille phillips

customer_reviews.title: Soft Comfortable easy To Adjust
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the back issues. Arrived on time in good packing. Easy to position. It is not too wide , which is good as can fit in many different chairs, however might be small for certain people. The firmness was overall good and lasting well into the week of use. A tab bit on the softer side for me, but wife likes it. Positioning strap is a plus!!
customer_reviews.author: munna bhai

customer_reviews.title: Must have for desk workers or even in the car!
customer_reviews.text: Great Buy. If you sit for a good amount of the day then you need a lumbar support. This is perfect for my back; the firmness is just right. Only con is it does have a tendency to roll to the bottom of the seat once you sit down, but you can just tighten the strap to stop this; I personally don't want to tighten the strap to much. I feel that will shorten its life span, which so far has been about 2 years for me and this thing is still going STRONG!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Too hard. Uncomfortable. Didn’t work for me. Would always slide down and could never keep it in a good place. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used to get backpains on longdrive.
customer_reviews.text: When I started using this pillow my lower back pain related after long drives or commute went away. Was the pillow responsible? I believe so, but I am not a doctor. This is my opinion and it is not a qualified medical advice.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this lumbar roll! This helps my back pain a lot. I sit at a desk all day for work and my back, neck and shoulders all feel so much better now that I use this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought per my Physical therapist's suggestion. Uncomfortable. Felt as if this was pushing me out of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Karen P.

customer_reviews.title: The cover will not last long
customer_reviews.text: The seams of the cover are starting to pull apart so this is actually a good foam pillow with a cheap cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jamzy Rob

customer_reviews.title: Item is very helpful
customer_reviews.text: It supports the back in the right places. It is light and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and pain reliever
customer_reviews.text: recommend from my physical therapist, very comfortable and helping relieve pain. No longer need make towel roll.
customer_reviews.author: chen wei

product_meta.title: The Original McKenzie Lumbar Roll by OPTP - Low Back Support for Office Chairs and Car Seats
feature_bullets: Trusted and authentic: Original McKenzie Lumbar Roll for back pain relief; the top-selling lumbar cushions and recommended choice of physical therapists, chiropractors, and back pain professionals around the world
Superior construction: High-quality, long-lasting foam with non-wrinkle, moisture-wicking, 100% polyester removable cover
Versatile use: Can be attached to office chairs, vehicle and plane seats; built-in strap fastens securely to most chair backs or around the waist
Professional support: Design ensures proper spine alignment and posture while sitting, providing comfortable back pain relief for the lumbar (low back) region

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,863 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
